pr_title: GEODE-7912: cacheWriter should be triggered when PR.clear

timeline.message:
GEODE-7912: cacheWriter should be triggered when PR.clear

        Co-authored-by: Anil <agingade@pivotal.io>
        Co-authored-by: Xiaojian Zhou <gzhou@pivotal.io>

timeline.bodyText: Typo here, this should be destroysByRegion.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: It seems inefficient and confusing to set the cache writer for all three data stores, then to immediately remove the writers for datastores1 and 2. Could you instead just pass false as the second argument for initDataStore() for those datastores?
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: I don't have to remove them. But I want to make sure the test is more deterministic.
replies.author: gesterzhou

replies.bodyText: I agree with Donal, doing this we are testing the behavior of AttributesMutator, not for clear.
replies.author: agingade

timeline.bodyText: Typo here, this should be destroys.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: Does this PR requires CacheListener testing.
replies.author: agingade

timeline.bodyText: Is there something missing here, or can this comment be removed?
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: The listener verification will also pass. But since the whole listener parts maybe refactoring, I comment it out for now. But we will revisit it.
replies.author: gesterzhou

timeline.author: DonalEvans
DonalEvans
DonalEvans
DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: There is "PartitionedRegionLoaderWriterDUnitTest" specific to testing loader and writers on PR. Probably we should move these tests over there.
timeline.author: agingade

replies.bodyText: I read the PartitionedRegionLoaderWriterDUnitTest. That is only to verify compatibility when creating region. We are testing the clear() operation's behavior.
replies.author: gesterzhou

replies.bodyText: You can add/extend the test as per your needs. The tests seems to be added for CacheLaderWriter and may be during that time, the need is to test create region.
replies.author: agingade

timeline.bodyText: The test is doing region destroy but the name suggests it is for clear. All the tests are doing region destroy, rather than clear.
timeline.author: agingade

replies.bodyText: I use destroy to compare. I can add a comments in the case. If I removed the destroy part, it's hard to show what's the expected behavior.
replies.author: gesterzhou

replies.bodyText: Probably separating test may be good idea. One for destroy and one for Clear.
replies.author: agingade

timeline.bodyText:
Can the caller pass in the Processor. We could avoid checking for operation.
Also is paction -> processorAction ? can we make it clear. Sorry for nitpicking. Just wanted to be clear with what we are doing.
timeline.author: agingade

replies.bodyText: fixed and I removed all the listener part tests
replies.author: gesterzhou

timeline.message: adjust the test case and remove the listener part
